books.description: The conservative commentator and radio host makes his case that the press is aligned with political ideology. Read by Jeremy Lowell and the author. 6 hours, 37 minutes unabridged.

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show." Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SAPIENS

books.author: Chelsea Handler
books.description: The comedian chronicles going into therapy and becoming an advocate for change. Read by the author. 5 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
books.title: LIFE WILL BE THE DEATH OF ME

books.author: Melinda Gates
books.description: The philanthropist shares stories of empowering women to improve society. Read by the author. 7 hours, 56 minutes unabridged.

books.author: with related materials  The Washington Post
books.contributor: with related materials by The Washington Post
books.description: Redacted findings from the special counsel’s investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election and potential obstruction of justice by the president. Read by Matt Zapotosky, Rosalind S. Helderman, Marc Fisher, et al. 19 hours, 14 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE MUELLER REPORT

books.author: John Carreyrou
books.description: The rise and fall of the biotech startup Theranos. Read by Will Damron. 11 hours, 36 minutes unabridged.

books.description: The author of “Magicians of the Gods” makes his case about the origins of civilizations. Read by the author. 17 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
